intro: Stigmaphyllon velutinum, commonly known as the velvet stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Stigmaphyllon velutinum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
